a.span: MI School Data Visit Our Dashboard

div.p: Orchard View Schools is located in Muskegon Township, just a few short miles east from the beautiful shoreline of Lake Michigan. The Muskegon River flows thru the northern corner, making our community a desired location for families of all different diversities.

p.a: Orchard View Continuity of Learning Plan during COVID-19

div.p: Earlier today, FIRST Robotics in Michigan, decided to postpone all FIRST Robotics competitions across the state in the coming weeks, following recommendations from public health officials. Out of an abundance of caution related to the coronavirus, they felt it would be best to postpone these events to help prevent the possible spread of the virus at one of their competitions. This includes the competition at OVHS this weekend.
Information regarding the rescheduling of these events is not currently available.

As you know, there are no known cases of the coronavirus in Muskegon, and local health officials have not suggested that events, gatherings, meetings, or schools close. At this time, all other events at Orchard View will continue as scheduled.
We will continue to communicate with and follow the guidance of, local health officials who are closely monitoring the situation here, across the state, and nationally.
For more information about the decision of FIRST robotics to postpone upcoming competitions, click the attached link.

div.p: Every 10 years, the U.S. Census Bureau undertakes a mammoth task: counting all the people residing in the United States. This count affects the allocation of funding for our community’s public resources (e.g., roads, hospitals, schools), how we plan for the future, and our voice in government. Learn more about the importance of the #2020Census and how to participate:
This website is best viewed using Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, or Internet Explorer 9 (or higher)

p.strong:
THE MUSKEGON PROMISE IS HERE:
2 YEARS OF COLLEGE – FREE !!!

div.p: The Muskegon Area Promise is a commitment to the young people of our community--that if they work hard they will be able to earn at least a two-year college degree tuition free. Read Superintendent Jim Nielsen's letter to parents to learn more about this awesome opportunity!! Promise letter to Parents.
